meta.title: Overlay
meta.description: The b-overlay component is used to visually obscure a particular element or component and its content. It signals to the user of a state change within the element or component and can be used for creating loaders, warings/alerts and more.

props.description: backgrund variant to use for the overlay backdrop
CSS color to use as the opaque overlay backdrop color. If set, overrides the `variant` prop
Opacity of the overlay backdrop. Valid range is 0 to 1
Apply rounding to the overlay to match your content routing. Valid values are `true`, `'sm'`, `lg`, `circle`, `pill`, `top`, `right`, `bottom`, or `left`
When set, disables centering of the overlay content (default content is a border spinner)
Element tag to use as for the overlay element
Disabled generating the wrapper element, and ignored the default slot. Requires that `<b-overlay>` be placed in an element with position relative set
When prop `no-wrap` is set, will use fixed positioning instead of absolute positioning. Handy if you want to obsucre the entire application page
Element tag to use for the overall wrapper element. Has no effect if prop `no-wrap` is set
z-index value to apply to the overlay. You may need to increase this value to suit your content
Type of the default spinner to show. Current supported types are 'border' and 'grow'
Applies one of the Bootstrap theme color variants to the default spinner
When set, renderes the default spinner in a smaller size

slots.name: overlay
slots.description: Custom content to repalce the default overlay spinner

slots.name: default
slots.description: The content to have overlay. The default slot is ignored if the prop `no-wrap` is set
